JB wrote:
> That last bit probably sounded more negative than you 
> intend=
ed it to, so I won't take it negatively or personally.

Please don't.  My p=
oint is just that I suspect you are
only thinking of JUnit-based unit tests=
.  And I would
agree that 14 hours of unit tests seems pretty weird.
But we=
're running JUnit-based system and acceptance
tests.  In my experience 14 h=
ours of automated system
testing isn't that unusual for a reasonably large =
and
complex software system.

Are they all valuable?  Yes, I think so.  The=
y all have
caught or could catch bugs.  In fact, if we had time, 
we would =
write more tests that would take even longer
to run, since I don't think we=
 have the test coverage
I'd like.

As far as the speed of feedback for 14 h=
our tests, again
these are system ("QA") type tests.  Comparing a 2 day
fee=
dback cycle to a 6 week feedback cycle (which is what
we've had on past pro=
jects) the 2 days is obviously a
monumental step forward.


Todd.
